DOC.brief_summary: A new immunosuppressive drug based on the inhibition of an important enzyme in the immune system called JAK3, is being developed by Pfizer to prevent transplant rejection. In this research study, a JAK3 inhibitor or cyclosporine will be given to new kidney transplant patients for 12 months in addition to other standard transplant medications such as prednisone.
DOC.brief_title: Study Of JAK3 Inhibitor For The Prevention Of Acute Rejection In Kidney Transplant Patients
DOC.criteria: Recipient of first time kidney transplant Between the ages of 18 and 70 years, inclusive Recipient of any nonkidney transplant
